revised_title: Comparative Illumination of Cassegrainian and Gregorian Telescopes
tldr: Henry Kater conducted experiments comparing the illumination of Cassegrainian and Gregorian telescopes. He found that the Cassegrainian telescope had a superior power of illumination, which could be due to the avoidance of light interference in the principal focus. This discovery could make the Cassegrainian telescope a valuable option for astronomical observations.
